page.title: 09 GANT'S MILL BRUTON.
page.content: Gant's Mill was built on the River Brue.Gants mill was probably not built until 1290.Its name came from John le Gaunt of Bruton.We presume he was the original builder. The early history is recorded in documents which were passed down to the Helyar family.They are preserved in Somerset Records Office. Gants Mill was probably one of the earliest fulling mills in the country. In the 17th century it became a cornmill as the woollen industry then moved north.Gant's Mill was converted to a flour and grist mill and leased to Mr John Lockyer,a miller from Sanford Orcas.For four generations the Lockyer fly operated the flour mill and animal feeding business. Gant's Mill was sold to the present owners by John Lockyer in 1949.
